What is the cause that true pietie and
grounded sincerity is of so smal account,
but because the world of the unregenerate
lieth in wickednes, and faith to
carnall affections bringeth little contentment?
How can it be that oppressours
extortioners, usurers, these idolatrous
worldlings, together with thousands of
delicious prodigals, should entertaine
the Gospell: since Zaccheus must divide
his goods, Mathew must bid farewell to
his place of customary receipt; yea the
people of God must use this world as if
they used it not? How hard therefore will
it be for such as trust in uncertaine riches,
to subiect themselves to this life of
faith? May not Gods Ministers take up a
lamentation, What happy tidings from
the word of faith which we preach? how
is the way to everlasting blisse plainly
beaten foorth, yet how few delight to
walke in it? How sluggish are our common
professours, that cannot watch one
houre?
Gods word the safest guide.

hypocrites, as if the unchangeable
poffessour of heaven and earth were
unfaithfull, or unable to recompence and
fully reward his faithfull peoples?
Thus we see, that streight is the way,
and small is the number that go it. Ephraim
is an unruly heifer that will not
be tamed. Ever have Gods Saints bene
like the shaking of an olive after the vintage.
Wicked men are mad men, they
will not be ordered; they are deafe men,
they will not heare, charme the Charmer
never so wisely. If that he sinne
which is not done of faith, how wofull
will it be with the greatest number, who
neither know nor beleeve, being blinde
and dissolute: having from their nonage
to their old age wandred from the waies
of God, being seven fold more the children
of hell then they were in their mothers
wombes? If all actions that want
faith be sins, how many are the sins of
those who were never enlightened with
the knowledge of God? My text hath
